item.title: fall-winter 2024-2025
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall spiraling nebula at different speeds cars in reverse these trees bless me with their leaves partly breezy today an evening ray of sun illuminates swarming gnats – the fountain’s patter skylight orange hue relaxing caress of air, nature’s sublime kiss winter magnolia tree - solving a boulder problem in the front yard two cigarette butts wedging deep into cedar bark – cold, cold heart in the roll of a wave the washing oak branches above carry me to the clouds

item.title: fall-winter 2023-2024
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall stillness in cool depths of subtle sweet hibiscus : 2 am meditation blind on cool morning whitetail doe grazes by aoudad cleanly slain winter rain patterns - Martian symphony leaves rushing breeze ardent flame young stars, flickering scores embers above bakeneko - wood spirit at sunset wash smoke away backbends fern’s bowing curl : rain taps above

item.title: fall-winter 2022-2023
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall noble warrior Thisis, solemn and true – great autumn oak guardian on the river’s vanishing edge hear his cry, a plea for esteem betrayal, reveals the flower of anger a true being Stillness in fall’s ancient air, Symmetry wheel grinds the autumn windstorm Beneath her feet looking out these big moments – seem so small breeze on skin – peace on surface water one long summer gasp out front white lake line murmurs, flowers whistle orphaned leaves dancing a war in overhead grass dots the orange sky winter unknown purpose - they search for so long in a cloudy sky hummingbird dodges, coursing standstill raindrops, please flip switch the spring!

item.title: fall 2021
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall numbing :: I feel nothing but feel the numbness nine friends bathing in the pool of fallen oak leaves flock of birds leaves in the wind shift in unison seventieth page the answer to my problem on an oak leaf hard stare my mind-body is zen autumn blows in different pretty shaped pink geranium in autumn twilight yellow maple blesses us all with autumn broken toe on my 24th birthday Autumn’s rebirth sometimes – it all just comes together in one house, for moving beings still autumn breeze my beginning ahead, gaze up my journey’s trail, behind my ends cornucopia : i love that word so much gradient from the autumn maple cone’s tip holly’s fruit infect leafless branches of a Yule tree

item.title: fall 2020
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: we were alive, but really we were dead
item.content:encoded: swordsmen sing among equinox flowers a fawn forages specter sets a trap around corners grow shadows no moon in skull town scale, fearless that spiny slope, unbowed hand pyramid, firm walking faster by cutting corners of acute sidewalks swollen with sugar lazy day leaves strange aftertaste an inside moral war how to write haiku without ever stepping outside I ran so far away the big hungry winter cuddle then devour upend my dirty growl behind my angry howl warm hearth filled with stronger fire – hope in overcast skies little in this world decided by one person too much is

item.title: fall-winter 2019-2020
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall subjects follow as queen bows her head – almost winter’s turn flock of ducks survey centennial waters sun bids the cold

item.title: fall-winter 2018-2019
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall to her autumn means outside ball is everything grey room fits dying leaves, not how he feels winter before happened two fraternal hounds – dry yard grass no order in time’s quanta next does not exist
